meanings.definition: Relating to or containing a chromophore.
meanings.sent1: The chromophoric molecule changed color when exposed to light.
meanings.sent2: The artist used chromophoric paints to create a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The chromophoric flowers in the garden seemed to glow in the dark.
meanings.sent4: Her chromophoric personality brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with chromophoric hues.

meanings.definition: Having the property of absorbing light.
meanings.sent1: The chromophoric fabric absorbed sunlight, keeping the room cool.
meanings.sent2: The chromophoric material was perfect for creating blackout curtains.
meanings.sent3: The chromophoric umbrella seemed to soak up all the sunlight around it.
meanings.sent4: His chromophoric skin seemed to drink in the sun's rays.
meanings.sent5: The chromophoric ink on the paper seemed to swallow the light.
